column2: Anglicanism describes itself as being a "via media", or middle way, between Protestantism and the Catholic Church. Following the Event, the highest authority in Anglicanism is the Archbishop of Canterbury.

The Free Churches (Or Nonconformists) are derived from British protestant groups that rejected the authority of the Anglican church after the event. While descended from diverse groups which banded together to survive the post-cataclysm world, the Free Churches share a common belief in the rejection of religious hierarchy, in religious freedom and some degree of pacifism.

A mighty fortress is our God, A bulwark never failing. The Lutheran Churches lost many things due to the event, but not their faith. Leading back to Martin Luther, the churches are united by the four soli: Sola fide, Sola Gratia, Solus Christus and Sola scriptura. This includes mostly Lutherans themselves as well as few other Evangelicals, most of them either led by a Synod or a Bishop. Despite them losing some ground, they stand steadfast in their defence against the new faiths and their belief in Jesus Christ.

The Mariavite Catholic Church traces its roots to Maria Franciszka, a pre-Event Polish noblewoman and visionary. It is said that during the tumultuous times of the End, she swayed Jezus to give the world another chance, and descended from the Heavens to aid mankind with miracles and counsel. As Rome was lost to the infidels and the world collapsed into barbarity, monks and zealots preached the need to return into simple life of Marya of Nazareth, the Mother of God, and Maria Franciszka, the Bride of Christ.\nAs the age of strife finally came to an end and the new Roman Pope's legate safely moved past pagan lands to reach Central Europe, he was shocked to find out that the Primas who greeted him was a woman. His refusal to negotiate with who he saw as illegitimate in apostolic succession, a "pagan in bishop's robes", cemented the new schism within Christianity. For the ages to come, the Mariavite Church would follow its own path under the patronage of Visegradian and Europan emperors.

A tradition holds that Pope Sylvester II created a holy relic Sacra Corona, a crown with three pieces of the True Cross. While the crafty pope originally intended the item to be a gift for Polish duke Boleslaus the Brave, an angelic apparition convinced him to give it to King Stephen of Hungary instead. Upon his deathbed, the holy king raised the Crown as an offering to Virgin Mary, who in turn imbued It with a part of Her divine presence. From now on, Sacra Corona would be viewed as a conduit of Godly powers and embodiment of the Realm only Its wearer is worthy of suzerainty, and even crowned the ruler is still inferior to the Crown Itself. The theology around Sacra Corona was promoted by Visegradian Emperors and their court chaplains, the Grand Primases of Esztergom. While at first gaining some popularity amongst bishops who refused teachings of Maria Francesca, the Coronite Church was betrayed by no other than the Crown wearers themselves. \n Following the folk uprisings in the north, Emperor Sándor the Schismatic officially recognised the She-Bishop of Plock as the head of Christian faithful and renounced Coronite theology as idolatrous. The remaining Coronites believe that the tragedies touching the Empire in following decades were just divine punishment for illegitimate rulers who had dared to lift themselves above the Crown.

Oasites are a radical reformation movement whose members claim that the mainstream Mariavites and Coronites betrayed Maria Francesca centuries ago, choosing the comfort of old ways over true salvation. Oasite faithful distaste war and refuse yielding to metropolitan bishops, believing that every Christian man and woman is consecrated through Baptism and shall follow Jesus's way of peace.
§Y*§! Homosexual Oasite rulers are allowed to marry other homosexual characters.

Being descended from the Protestant Reformation and Reformators like John Calvin, Huldrych Zwingli, John Knox and several others, these Christians focus on the Bible alone. Sacraments like Eucharist are seen as merely symbolic. This, together with the theological concept of Predestination in some Reformed Churches, makes ecumenical cooperation with many of their Christian Brethren difficult, despite them sharing the four Sola with the Lutherans. Nonetheless, they hold their beliefs with a deep conviction.

After the event, the fractured church nearly schismed over issues of succession. Following this, Patriarchs Nicodemus of Constantinople, Mihai of Romania, and Sergey of Moscow as well as Sephirot, Archbishop of Athens, convened an eccumenical council to decided the emerging theological and practical disputes that had emerged over the centuries of separation and chaos following the event. Rome was considered "in the Jurisdiction of the autonomous church of Rome" it was replaced by Moscow, in addition, the Greek Church would fall under the Jurisdiction of the Eccumenical Patriarchate. Furthermore, they affirmed the practice of Hesychasm and noted that the ultimate goal of the devout was Theosis, the ultimate union with the divine Christ through intimate knowledge of salvation.

Old Believers, sometimes called "Old Calendarists" or "Old Ritualists", are a group of Orthodox Christians that view the move to the Revised Julian/Gregorian Calendar and the updated Byzantine rite as Roman or Constantinoplean interference and instead use their traditional Julian calendar and local rite.

The Dukhovnye, spiritual Christians, are a sect of Christians who arose from pietist and communal movements in Orthodox Christianity and incorporate a variety of practices centred around simplicity, personal devotion, pacifism, and ecumenicism. They have few organized priests, instead favouring congregational attitudes leading to comparisons between them and German Anabaptist groups such as the Mennonites.

The Doves believe that original sin tainted the body irreparably, giving rise to the most grevious of sins, lust.  To combat this and be closer to God, they undertake acts of extreme austerity and self-harm.  The most faithful of the community become the perfects by taking the greater seal, the removal of genitals and breasts.

Catholicism is one of the oldest branches of Christianity, and it survived the cataclysmic events of centuries past by the skin of its teeth. As always the formal head of the religion is the Bishop of Rome - the Pope. After the Deluge, the Papal authority of Rome was force to step out of merely being a spiritual head of the faith but also a leader for the many Catholics of the Old Continent. The Post-Antediluvian Popes in the centuries since have reestablish the Papal States to better maintain and prevent the core of the Catholic World from slipping away to the whims of Anti-Popes and Heathens. Standing upon a new foundation, the church once more looks outwards in hopes of restoring contact and mending its ties with its wayward devoutee at home and in distant lands so that once more like in the days of Old, the Church can truly be a "Universal Church".

Termed 'Apparitionists' by those who frown upon them, these Marian devotees have elevated esctasies and divine visions to the level of dogma. Believing each new revelation makes the light of faith shine brighter, ecstacies, visions, and possessions are common among the Apparitionists, and even expected of their rulers.

The Christians of St. Thomas are the oldest in India, tracing their lineage back to the disciple Thomas and his missions to India, they hold themselves to have an unbroken apostolic lineage to Christ himself. After the event, they were united by a council of the various Archbishops the St. Thomas Christian sects as well as those from Goa and Mumbai to form the current church which is united in using the East Syriac Rite and an official Christology that recognizes both Hypostasis and Theopaschitism.

Tracing their descent to the same journey of Thomas, the Ezharapallikals set themselves apart from the Nasrani by their move towards folk practices and lack of ecclesiastic hierarchy. Furthermore, they believe that the bible is corrupted, favoring the Devotional songs of Thomas passed down by their forbearers. They are Docetists and Gnostics, believing that Christ could not be merely a man and god incarnate as humanity is corruptible and prone to sin. Thus for Christ to be entirely pure, he must have not possessed a material existence.  They seek union with Christ and removal from material existence entirely.

As the Papacy in Rome retreated to the shadowy recess as the Event Sundered old Rome until nothing but ash coated its once mighty streets, the periphery of the Catholic World had to fend for themselves to protect their monasteries and parishes from perishing before a new age of religious strife unseen in Christendom since the times of Old. Isolated by the cruel march of time, even as the Vicar of Rome returned into public life and Rome Rebuilt upon St.Peter's Rock, Those few that remain hesistant to once more fall within communion with Rome hold that it is best that in this new and uncertain world that one's local parish is more important then relying on the promises of a distant patriarch.

Dime, pecador si en gracia no estás cuando Dios te llama a su tribunal. Tu seno de culpas allí se verá y aun las más ocultas, patentes serán.\nBranching off from the Insular movement in recent years, the Capirotes believe in constant and extreme mortification and self-denial, as penance for the Event. The Capirotes are ruled by the Sacerdote de la Sangre, who is elected by a council of fraternities and charged with protecting the faithful. Through penance and most holy suffering, they may yet restore the church to it's Antediluvian glory.

The United Oriental Apostolic Church traces its origin in a union between the five miaphysite churches of the East: the Coptic Church, the Tewahedo Church of Ethiopia, the Tewahedo Church of Eritrea, the Syriac Orthodox Church, and the Armenian Apostolic Church. During the Council of Sawhaj in 2381 the six churches were made into one under the guidance of the Emperors of Egypt and Ethiopia. The Apostolics are Miaphysite, believing Christ to have one nature where both the divine and human are united. At the resolution of the council, the Presbyterates of Alexandria, Axum, Marseille, Etchmiadzin, and Antioch were raised. The Apostolics put great emphasis on the Cenobitic system established by Saint Pachomius the Great.

The Reformed Church of the East is a loose confederation of churches who while disagreeing among themselves are a united voice seeking to reform various aspects of the Churches of the East. Self ascribed as Evangelicals and Pentecostal, they seek to devest supreme church authority away from the Patriarches to the hands of local bishops. Theologically significant to their belief in the spirtual cleansing and rebirth of the spirit via the Holy Spirit.

As the deluge upended the old order, the distant northern Patriarch of Moscow, the Patriarch of all Russia stood as a beacon of hope in the darkness. As the dark age of disunity came to an end a great ecumenical council of the East was convened which affirmed the standing practice of Hesychasm and the ultimate goal of the devout was Theosis. While this council established the elevated position of Moscow in place of Rome, the successors of Sergey did not believe the council went far enough to recognize the contributions of Moscow to the furtherment of the Church. This bitterness eventually sundered the Church as like Rome, the Autonomous Church in Moscow was established dividing the Orthodox World once more.

Far from the opulent centers of the Patriarkh's authority, the small folk of Russia hold to the veneration of ancient saints who are said to protect the spirutal heart of All-Russia. Adorning their small hamlets with icons of the blessed saints, they believe the Event was a punishment sent by God for the sins of the Old World. They believe that the Patriarkh has long disregarded the spiritual needs of All-Russia and thus took it upon themselves to call upon the saints to intercede with God so they can reach Theosis.

The Ruh'i School was founded on the principles of exploration of faith outside the strict adherence to traditional norms generally accepted among other Sunni schools of Jurisprudence. Instead believing that an examination of other faith's traditions can enrich the experience of being a pious Muslim. As a result they do not wish to impose ghazi upon unbelievers. Believers of this school contend that the inward Focus of Nizami on strictly adhering to ancient traditions and Muslim brotherhood makes them unflexible in sea of great changes sweeping across the stagnant old continent.

Alevis are the followers of the doctrine of Hajji Bektash Veli. Alevism is an esoteric and mystical interpretation of Islam venerating a trinity composed of Muhammad, Al-Haqq and Ali (Al Haqq being Allah, at the center of the trinity). Allah is the supreme judge and perceiver, omnipotent, omniscient and merciful. The fundamental religious doctrine of the Alevis is the duality between Esoteric (iç yüzü) and Exoteric (zahir). The duality is at the center of the Qurans interpretation and of the world itself. To them, though the Quran is the initiatory path which passes through the four narrow doors of knowledge to reach God-Reality, the choice of the course is a matter of method.

The Nizami School has developed towards an inward facing, perfectionist, but still cosmopolitan stance of Sunni jurisprudence (like Ruh'i). Nizami adherants believe the importance in strengthening the bonds between brothers of the Faith and conducting themselves by the ancient Fatwas and traditions that have upheld Islam through the darkness of the Event. A solid foundation they believe is the root of Faith. Emphasizing Islamic unity, they uphold the legendary tolerance of the Old Caliphs as people to aspire to emulate, while protecting the great legacy of Old threatened by the tide of Change.

Following the Disaster, the larger Sunni world plunged into chaos as the new age of strife set brother against brother, creed against creed, and madrasah against madrasah. It was through the rise of the Empire in Egypt, and the active work of multiple scholars, that a semblance of order was once more restored to the now fractured world of competing schools of thought. Holding to the old madhhabs and the lessons of the four wise imams, the Majlisi folk - so named because of their taking fatwa from the Majlis in Al-Azhar - trust and follow in God's ultimate justice for the good of humanity.

The oldest of the schools of conservative Sunni Islam thought they uphold the general Salafi views of literalist interpretations of the Quran and are mistrustful of the Madhi and other jurisprudence of Islamic Law as forms of "intrepretation" of god's uncorrupted reason. Proclaiming Tawhid (Devotion) to the one God all that is necessary against the sea of idolatry against the Oneness of God Almighty. As such also viewing bid'ah (Change) with great suspicion.

One of the ancient schools of Shia Islam, The Ismailite Imam descend from the line of Muhammad ibn Isma'il said to have entered occultation until the coming day of judgement to lead his people in the name of god. Ismailte seek to study God Almighty through the examination of Batin (inward self) and Zahir (outward self). And thus have a long tradition of Ta'wil (elucidate) the meaning of the Quran as an allegory. This approach being an attempt to find greater hidden meaning to uplift both aspects of the soul to higher spirituality with God Almighty.

Zaidiyyah, otherwise known as Fivers, is the oldest branch of Shia Islam born from the martyrdom of Zaid who revolted against the unjust rule of the Umayyad Caliph Hisam ibn Abd al-Malik. They believe that imamate succession fell upon the Zaid line but are much less strigent on the matter of Ummah succession as they do not believe in the infalliablity of heriditary succession of the Ummah. That being that it should not be limited to direct father to son succession as it is in other Shia Schools. In all Zaydi contend in humanity's responsiblity to carry out justice in the witness of God as they believe Zaid did when he rose against the wicked Caliph.

Twelver Shia Muslims believe the Twelve Imams from Ali to Madhi were all divinely ordained leaders who carry the Prophet Muhammad infalliable essence of Hikmah (Knowlege) of Islamic Law and Juriprudence. They await the return of Imam Madhi from Occulation to join faithful muslims upon the battlefield against the terrible Dajjal at the end times. They hold that only the Imam descended from the lineage of the prophet may hold the esteem office of the Ummah. A belief that share with other Shia Schools is the belief in the balance of Batin and Zahir (The Inner and Other Self).

Ibadi Muslim hold themselves apart from the wider Sunni and Shia Rivalry positioning themselves in their local communities as elected imams. Emphasizing the actions of the learnt nature of an Imam as an important pillar of their communities. Whether sworn to secrecy, exchanging their life to the divine, ruling the Sultanate, or fighting to defend their community the imam are beholden to their people as much as any ruler in any realm and can be relieved of their assign duties. As they themselves are simply Custodians of their community.

Whilst much of the Ummah saw the Event as a test by God, the Revivalist sect saw it in a very different light. The Event was no test-- it was a reckoning, a punishment from God for the sins of society. Ostracized from the Traditionalist community, the Revivalists believed the only way to "revive" society and lift God's punishment was to cleanse sin and heresy from this world.

We are people that will not surrender, we win or we die. These words were spoken by the wise Lion of the Desert, who objected to the sectarian divisions plaguing the Ummah, instead seeking the path of liberation. Following the path he and the other great Walis of revolution set, the warriors of al-Taharur seek to liberate all their Muslim brethren from the fists of tyrants and the wicked occupiers.

Muwahideen, Believers in the Oneness of God, hold that when the final battle comes for all, God will cast great tyrants and the last djinns to the bowels of hell for seeds borne of their cruel actions and misdeeds. Believing their role in God's grand design being as his sword casting judgement and liberating souls from tyranny so that they may march on the side of God in the final battle in opposition to the defensive stance of Taharurites.

Before the Disaster, the last Khilafa' ended in treachery and foreign domination. Though many claimed the title of Caliph since those days, none were truly recognized. Following the Reconciliation Council, a new Caliph was declared as a unifying head to the Sunni movements of the Post-Disaster world. Through long discussions of reconcilation and compromise this unified front has collectively been referred to as the "Ahl-al Sunnah" movement, striving to uphold the three promises of tradition, brotherhood, and truthfulness. Engrained in these promises are the understanding that by tradition one can recover what has been lost and strengthen what exists, by brotherhood one could stand together as cohesive front and prevent another collapse of the Muslim world, and by truthfulness one is able to navigate a world vastly changed by the Disaster while remaining true to the universal truth - One God.

Huíjiào, the religion of the Hui, represents a cultural understanding of the essence of Islam - Truth and Purity, as sublime characteristics of the One God. A defining difference that sets them apart from other Muslims is their veneration of the sage wisdoms of Kongzhi and their adoption of many Chinese customs. The traditions of Islamic thought live on through the scholarly muses of Ma Scholars who, like their Confucian peers, believe in the orderly dispension of Heaven to be paramount.

The Barelvis are a sufi-oriented strain of Indian Islam who believe firmly in sufistic concepts such as the "light of Muhammad," the doctrine that Muhammad was one of Gods first creation, given form upon his birth and that he now exists as a formless light to work under Gods direction and intercede on the behalf of Muslims around the world simultaneously. They believe firmly in the efficacy of Muslim saints and the chanting of Dhikr. This sets them apart from other Muslim movements in the Subcontinent that firmly stand against Sufi practices.

Deobandi are a sect of the Hanafi School from the Indian Subcontinent which strongly believes in the doctrine of taqlid in lull of mujtahid. Because of this, study of scripture is highly valued among the Deobandi and learning is placed in equal importance to mysticism and revelation, since these are believed to have long since passed and only given to the prophets. Believing through careful examination of the word, one can dispell falsehood and blind faith. While they typically eschew traditional sufi practices of groups like the Barlevis they still highly regard the chanting of the names of God, as an auspicious and pious practice.

Since the time before the Event, Haredi Jews have attempted to preserve what they believe is the correct form of Judaism by isolating themselves in tight-knit, insular communities. Haredi men in all parts of society dedicate much of their time to the study of Torah and Talmud, from youth until old age. After the event, many Haredi pilgrims began to resettle in the old country, building communities near the graves of Tzaddiks. Whether living in exile or in the chaos of the holy land, Haredim still patiently await the arrival of the Moshiach, who will, even though he tarries, gather the exiles, and restore the Promised Land and Holy Temple.

The Haskalah (lit. Enlightenment) Movement first emerged before the Event, and its ideals have managed to persist among Jewish communities throughout the centuries. While opinions differ between the various denominations on approaches to Halakha (Jewish Religious Law)," all permit women to be ordained as rabbis and allow marriage between same-sex couples. The Jews of the Haskalah maintain that individual Jews should work towards restoring the pre-Event world through good works and philanthropy. This principle is known as "Tikkun Olam"-- literally, "repair of the world".
§Y*§! Homosexual Haskalah rulers are allowed to marry other homosexual characters.

Long ago the Jews of Israel were cast across the world by a great exile, greater even then the one described in the Torah. But it was said in the final throes of humanity before the event, the long exile was ended and all of Jews across their scattered communities and traditions returned to Israel to rebuild what was once lost. These are the origins for the people who now call themselves Ha'Ivrim. Standing in a precarious situation once more with the constant turmoil of squabbling warlords, they choose to rally behind the great tradition of debate and the persistent spirit of all Jews to face the challenges that have laid before them, with both the knowledge of Torah and of the outside world to guide them. No matter which rites or traditions they may follow, they are ultimately at the end striving to live by God's Commandments. A united people in faith to God Almighty, Kol Israel Arevim Ze Ba-Ze.

L'état, c'est moi so sayeth the Lord, the Radiant Sun of the Universe who sent the first King of Kings, Jesus the Lord, and the ever faithful Maid, the Holy Spirit of the Divine Order, to defend him and his subjects in the Kingdom of Heaven. Through the emanation of the Heavenly Sovereign, he was born to a Virgin Queen. Jesus's benevolence as sovereign of the Kingdom of Heaven is a tale much lauded by believer of his divine kingship. Believing that to rule one must follow the example of Jesus the Lord, as did the Sun King of Man did so long ago. Many lords who still uphold the legendary fundamentals seek to restore the cosmic right, The Radiant Lord of the Universe intended.

After the first Sun King declared to his followers that he was an heir to not just the Kings of old but Jesus himself, his closest companion, Le Bon Chevalier, left in disgust, with half of their knights. These knights were the first generation of the Chevaliers. They hold close their code of chivalry, claiming that it is deeds and virtue, not blood that makes one worthy to rule in the eyes of God. The Chevaliers seek to follow the ways of the Nine Worthies of old, the great knights and rulers blessed by God himself.

Originally a small brotherhood in the Azores dedicated to the cult of o Desejado the Lost King who will one day come back and estabilish the Fifth Empire, it's adherents have grown outside the archipelago and are known throughout the Atlantic as raiders and conquerors. It's rulers are not justified by Divine Right, they are instead acclaimed by the population and expected to do their duty and keep their promises to Desejado, their actions being seen in a pelagic sense the wealth they collect in their journeys meant to be shared and war must be made on the trasgos and other enemies of the Quinto Império so that O Desejado may finally return.

Folketro, or Folk Faith, is the native religion of Scandinavia, an amalgation of Lutheranism and Nordic folklore. It is naturally viewed with suspicion by the Christian world due to its rather unorthodox belief system," such as venerating the "Hidden Folk", local spirits and supernatural beings. They view the Event as the fabled Ragnarok, which destroyed much of the Old World in a cataclysmic war between the Old Gods.

The Forn Sed faith is a branch of the Folketro Tradition which focuses on veneration of saints, Jesus and God than folkloric beings like Askeladden. A great trio of mighty saints stand as the foremost entities of Forn Sed belief, save God and Jesus
column3: Sankte Per, the gatekeeper of heaven, who sends the unworthy to where the Mountain King dines with the Devil. Santa Lucia, the maiden of light whose bright flames made the great darkness which the Event brought a little more bearable. Sankt Olav, the eternal king who sent trolls north-and-down with his silver axe and golden lion.

column2: In contrast to mainstream Folketro Traditions, avid believers of Trolltro venerates one being above all others, the mysterious Huntsman whose terrible Wild Hunt shows up whenever the world is ready for a new Ragnarok. Harkening back to the days when men still rode dragons across the waves, they view other religions with far more hostility than its Folketro and Forn Sed counterparts and they eagerly await the coming of their terrible messiah, the Allfader...

Since the beginning of creation the Gospodar, the Lord of Light and the Celestial Host, has been in eternal divine combat with the rebellious daemons who seek to drag the world into everlasting darkness. Second only the Gospodar was the Arkhistrateg, the Archangel of Justice, who with its mighty sword fought on behalf of the Gospodar slashing away the deceit and tyranny of the Great Deciever upon the back of celestial steeds. Through the Arkhistrateg, men of great merit, saints of virtue and valor were immortalized for their great battles against daemons dying gloriously in the name of the faith, the exemplar of which was the Venerable Iisus Nazariy, a martyr for the righteous.

The Druze are a group that emerged from Ismailism and incorporates Gnostic, Shiite, and Neoplatonic texts into their canon. Believing that God can give his essence to individuals as well as take form, they venerate various figures as the embodied god, chief among them Fatimid Caliph al-Hakim and Adam, the first man. A somewhat insular community, it is rare for them to accept outsiders.

The Êzîdîs are a syncretic sect of Zoroastrianism, Gnosticism, Iranic religion, and Islam who live on the fringes of Islamic society. Believing themselves the descendents of Adam alone, they believe they alone are chosen by Khwoda who is emanated in the form of the Seven Angels, led by Tawuse Melek. They revere Sheikh Adi as one of the principal founders of their religion along with his companions. They adhere to strict laws of purity and shun outsiders.

A secretive and syncretic faith, the Alawi have long lived in small communities in the Levant. They originate from the disciple Ibn Nusayr as a continuation of Twelver Shi'ite thought, but beyond that, much of their practices are unkown. They believe in the one God - who some allege manifests as triad - and are alleged to partake in a communion-like ritual to obtain his transubstantiated essence. They are also believed to accept reincarnation, allegedy believing that they were originally the souls of the stars and must incarnated in human form to once again join the divine as formless souls in the heavens.

Sometimes called Yarsanis or Kaka'is, the followers of Ahl-e Haqq are loosely organized around the teachings of Gorani Mystic Sultan Sahak. Their beliefs are a fusion of Ghulat Shi'ism and pre-Islamic folk traditions as well as Zoroastrianism and Manichaeism. They believe in a succession of incarnations of God who brought the religion to them each accompanied by four angels, as well as a cycle of 1001 rebirths to purify the soul. Ritual use of songs and poetry play a vital part in their relgion.

Neuhumanism holds a belief in the Creator, who is revealed by the application of reason and philosophy, and the capability of human beings to know and understand Truth. It looks back to the fabled time of Enlightenment as the high point man's intellect, when the closest was delved to the Deity's intellect. While maintaining many Abrahamic roots, their deistic view on the Creator and its openness to any school of thought that adheres to its Five Maxims has distanced it from the Abrahamic faiths.
§Y*§! Homosexual Neuhumanist rulers are allowed to marry other homosexual characters.

In the passing of the Ages, much truth is lost to fate and misfortune and many things that should not be forgotten are. But by chance or design, they may be sung into the world once more. Valinorism is based on a rediscovered holy text called the Silmarillion. Founded from the ruins of Oxford, Valinorists believe in a detailed history, order of gods, and spirituality which is seemingly divorced from the other religions of Britain. With their henotheistic reverence of the fourteen Powers and the All-Father, fascination with craft and creation, and almost welcoming view of death, they have long stood apart from more established pre-Fall faiths. Though much reduced from their temporal height in Britain, Valinorist realms still cling on to the shores of the Irish Sea.

Old Albion fell harder than most, her institutions and cities were completely swallowed in the madness of the Event. By the time the potentates of Britain organized and got back on their feet little was left of the old civilization. In the face of this spiritual vacuum they fell back on the fragments still known and recorded of Old Albion. In those ancient days there were great theologians, mystic-princes, bards that enchanted all of Europe, and ruling over them all was a wise and faultless Virgin Queen who shielded her people from all harm. Rulers and covens of scholar-priests still pay homage to the Prime Minister and the Two High-Houses of Parliament gathered around the empty throne. Many pray for an end to the long interregnum, and the return of the once and future Queen.

Thelema is a British mystic religion "spiritual philosophy" developed by Aleister Crowley, based on the law: "Do what thou wilt shall be the whole of the Law." It is a polytheistic religion that draws its pantheon of gods from the religious beliefs of Ancient Egypt.
§Y*§! Homosexual Thelema rulers are allowed to marry other homosexual characters.

The Roerichans are practitioners of Agni Yoga, an all pervading system of ethics and lifestyle that is said to lead towards the ultimate progress of humanity.  By practicing Agni Yoga, one not only furthers their own spiritual health and development, but that of all mankind leading to the golden age of the new humanity, wherein Master Morya will be reborn in an Earthly body as Manu and lead humanity into the new age wherein all war and disease is overcome and we have all embraced the true religion of the mother goddess and first cause Ur Aditi.

Neoplatonists believe in a world emanating from the One through the divine intellect which divides the world into the many.  Through a complex series of emanations from the Monad into the Diad, the Diad into the Triad, the souls of the world were split from the one oversoul, and wish to return to the primal state of pure intellect and pure good.  As such, rites are performed to more powerful and pure beings to achieve worldly effects, but only through the practice of theurgy and the proper rights can one achieve the true goal, reunion of the individual soul with the pure soul of the One, the supreme good from which all things originate.

Jedinstvo is the name for a group of moral and spiritual traditions of the Western Balkans. Its fundamental beliefs in the power of collective unity and struggle, maintanance of brotherhood eace amongst man and worship of old heroes and ancestors have tied the religion deeply across the region. Jedinstvo followers believe that Tito, a warrior-poet, forged the path for human understanding, compassion and knowledge of the collective divine. With his departure, people diverged from his precepts, leading to the downfall of humanity and the event.

§Y*§! Jedinstvo rulers may undertake pilgrimages to Spomeniks. \n§Y*§! Jedinstvo rulers may select a partisan to model themselves after. \n§Y*§! Jedinstvo characters might become venerated if they are true examples of virtue.

Claiming origins in the antediluvian periods in the hazy times of the event, Chroniclers believe and pay reverence to an entity known as Monad, the transcendent creator of the universe and source of all knowledge. The old world created great wonders with the gifts from Monad. However, the ancient ones grew indolent and filled with the vices of ignorance and sloth, believing technology was their servant, even binding and splitting the great spirit Atomos. This corruption lead to the event when Entropy was released and much of the world being defiled. Entropy now seeks to unmake the world, returning it to a cold empty state of existence devoid of Monad's light. The Chronicler truth is that labor and technology are meditations on reality, and the only way to achieve a transcendent unity with the Monad. The Chroniclers are divided between three traditional paths, Forgers, Physicians and Physicists.

Once, a world and several lifetimes ago, there was the Republic. Gods walked freely and mingled with mankind, treating with them as equals. The people lived in peace and prosperity, knowing that the virtues of Liberty, Equality and Fraternity guided them towards just and fair government, through the consent of all. But then came the Event, and the Republic shattered, lost to the tyranny and perfidy of those who sought to cast her down. To this day, the Jacobin folk live and revere the memory of the world-that-was, steadfastly clinging to memories of a time long bygone and hoping that the utopia of the old world shall one day come to life again. But just as the Old Republic was built at swordpoint and watered with the blood of tyrants, mayhaps it is time for the people to rise again and restore just and virtuous rule once more
§Y*§! Homosexual Marianne Jacobin rulers are allowed to marry other homosexual characters.

Along the sacred steppes and desert oases, the Zimiran faithful remember the days in which men rode steel chariots to the stars. One day, they too hope to travel the stars, drawing the Mahdi out of his occlusion in order to bring about the Day of Judgement and fix the broken world. To bring about that day, they hold faith in God and his Prophet Muhammed, studying the mysteries of the stars and wandering the steppes in hope of reaching unity with God. Man reaches wisdom by learning through seeing, reading, and studying. The wiser he becomes, the closer he is to God.

Long ago, the people lived in ignorance and darkness, under tyranny of The Old. Through their labor and piety, they empowered The Will, a mighty and supernatural force that would lead them towards Bright Future Ahead, a perfect society free from greed, war and famine. With The Worker and The Kolkoznitsa each playing their roles, The Will came close to bringing about Bright Future, defeating the wicked Uninvited, before the chaos of the event let spirits of The Old destroy this progress. But the stalwart members of the Proletkult were not shaken. They continue to soldier on, ever laboring in the hopes of following The Will and bringing about Bright Future Ahead.

The Satyagrahi follow the 9 maxims (ahimsa, honesty, non-stealing, generosity, labour, abstinence, fearlessness, respect for all beliefs, and collective self-sufficiency) of Bapu in search truth. To the Satyagrahi, truth is the way to Dharma which is the meaning of God. They have a firm belief in pacifism and remember an ancient foe defeated through truth and kindness rather than violence.

What exactly occurs in the imperial court is not known, but many theories exist, one of the more famous ones being that Heaven sent Guan gong as an executioner because the degeneracy of the court reached a peak. Its unknown exactly what happened, but at the end, the celestial court was said to be judged before the Heavenly Order and the Middle Kingdom was casted in a great dark age of unenlightment. But through the wise rule of restored Hong Family they vanquish the horrible demons and daji who plagued the lands with absolute filial piety and truth. But as an old addage goes "Old is the Heaven, and necessary are the changes", and even the mighty Hong are human and one day the Daji will come to reap man's folly.

Across the rugged North Sea one might find the scattered followers of what many call the Sjótrúar, the folk of the Sea. A broad term that encompasses many lesser cults dedicated to local deities, spirits and culture heroes, one constant links them together
column3: the veneration of the Sea as the great life-giving force for all mankind, be this in the shape of Arnakuagsak or Njörður. Whaling has, even from the time efore the Deluge, always been an important aspect of the lives of the people adhering to this disorganized religion and it is almost universally considered a rite of passage for young men.

column2: An amalgamation of the faiths of the herders of northern Russia and Siberia. They follow a henotheist and semi-monist religion led by a group of Najts who are akin to the Uralic Shaman. Their worship is highly mobile as they are mostly nomadic or semi-nomadic so religious paraphernalia is small and portable and thus held within their sleds.

An amalgamation of the faiths of the herders of northern Russia and Siberia. They follow a henotheist and semi-monist religion led by a group of Najts who are akin to the Uralic Shaman. Their worship is highly mobile as they are mostly nomadic or semi-nomadic so religious paraphernalia is small and portable and thus held within their sleds.

Nartists are a monotheistic sect who incorporate ancient beliefs of the Caucasus with outside influence from Christianity, theosophy, and Sufi Islam. They believe that when god created the world, he emanated the divine Satanaya who gave birth to six children, the Narts, who would become known as the chief incarnations of the supreme god. These Narts fought against the demons that infested the land and brought knowledge to the people. Nartism is monistic, where the individual's soul is part of a unitary force created by Xwystau.

They believe that when god created the world, he emanated the divine Satanaya who gave birth to six children, the Narts, who would become known as the chief incarnations of the supreme god. These Narts fought against the demons that infested the land and brought knowledge to the people. Nartism is monistic, where the individual's soul is part of a unitary force created by Xwystau.

The Great Khan, Chinggis Han, Lord Sovereign of the Universe. From the steppes, a humble prophet proclaimed that Chinggis's feats were not possible by any human hands, and that he had been none other than a deity- with his divine blood flowing through his descendents who continue to watch their heavenly father ride great divine hordes to seize the heaven in eternal glory. His followers hold the Steppes sacred reguarly burning offerings in his name so that his unconquerable spirit may return once more re-incarnate onto this Earth.

From the steppes, a humble prophet proclaimed that Chinggis's feats were not possible by any human hands, and that he had been none other than a deity- with his divine blood flowing through his descendents who continue to watch their heavenly father ride great divine hordes to seize the heaven in eternal glory. His followers hold the Steppes sacred reguarly burning offerings in his name so that his unconquerable spirit may return once more re-incarnate onto this Earth.

As the Russians began colonizing the Altai region, the Turkic peoples began to create a modified version of their religion.  Millennarian movements emerged telling of the old white rider, Ak-Burkhan, who had merged with the gods and would unite the Altai peoples.  They began to reject the Shamans for their consorting with the deities of the underworld and their sacrifices and absorb Buddhist practices, creating a new religion.

As the Russians began colonizing the Altai region, the Turkic peoples began to create a modified version of their religion.  Millennarian movements emerged telling of the old white rider, Ak-Burkhan, who had merged with the gods and would unite the Altai peoples.  They began to reject the Shamans for their consorting with the deities of the underworld and their sacrifices and absorb Buddhist practices, creating a new religion.

In the time following the event the tribes of Assam banded together in order to preserve their way of life and hold off destruction, this led to a mixture of religion and culture in the region. The Adi religion blended the religions of the tribal populations. This mixture resulted in a unique belief system that revered male-female pairs of deities as well as ancestors.  The world was born from the Godhead and world principal Sedi, who manifested first as Donyi, the sun, and Polo, the moon.  Then, they manifested the 18 god pairs and the 5 elements. Sedi, seeing this then created the first man Abotani who became the ancestor of humankind. The religion places a strong emphasis on the dualistic male female principal of the universe through a dual priesthood.

The Adi religion blended the religions of the tribal populations. This mixture resulted in a unique belief system that revered male-female pairs of deities as well as ancestors. Sedi, seeing this then created the first man Abotani who became the ancestor of humankind. The religion places a strong emphasis on the dualistic male female principal of the universe through a dual priesthood.

The Sarna Sthal are the sacred groves of the tribal people of East India.  The Mundic people of India have long held a set of beliefs in the sacred groves and natural features which contain the essence and dwelling of their gods. Sticking strongly to their folklore and beliefs, they have resisted and syncretized with the Hindus who have surrounded them for thousands of years, even spreading their gods to the surrounding Hindus.  They hold their own code of ethics and laws, based principally on the relationship to the forests and groves which are sacred to them.  They hold a series of gods, called Bonga, who can be benevolent or malevolent.  Most of these Bonga are localized to a village or region, though some are near universally worshiped, such as the creator whose name varies by language but is called "the Great Bonga" by all, as well as the Mother of Humankind, known as Maran Bulu to the Santali and the Jaher Era, who oversees the sacred groves.  Additionally, family totems are thought to guard and protect the clans.

Sticking strongly to their folklore and beliefs, they have resisted and syncretized with the Hindus who have surrounded them for thousands of years, even spreading their gods to the surrounding Hindus. Additionally, family totems are thought to guard and protect the clans.

From eons old folklore, which survived the Event through oral tradition, emerged the Népmese religion, meaning simply "Folktale" in its adherents' language. This lore of old is not just "stories" to the Népmese faithful - to them, it is  ancient wisdom, preserved from generation to generation, which contains important lessons about life and the workings of the divine. Some of this folklore is as old as time itself, while some has clear Chirstian influences, resulting in this belief system being highly syncretic and volatile in its nature. They believe in the existence of the World Tree, on the top of which seats God, or Isten, and among whose roots dwell the evil servants of the Devil, also known as Ördög.

§Y*§! Ultimogeniture is the default succession type.
§Y*§! Ultimogeniture is the default succession type.

Adonists believe that the world began in a primordial chaos from which two beings were born, Belus and Bitlis.  From their union was born Moloch.  However he created only evil and thus his creations were destroyed and he cast out.  Belus and Bitlis once again produced offspring, the twins Adonis and Dido.  Adonis endeavored to create the world and mankind in the image of himself and Dido, but was then slewn by Moloch who began corrupting Adonis' creation by introducing evil.  Adonis was revived by Dido, but Moloch sent false prophets to bring monotheism and predjudice to the world, styling himself as God.  Adonists believe they can create the perfected sixth aeon through worship of Adonis and Dido in sensual ritual.

Adonists believe that the world began in a primordial chaos from which two beings were born, Belus and Bitlis.  From their union was born Moloch.  However he created only evil and thus his creations were destroyed and he cast out.  Belus and Bitlis once again produced offspring, the twins Adonis and Dido.  Adonis endeavored to create the world and mankind in the image of himself and Dido, but was then slewn by Moloch who began corrupting Adonis' creation by introducing evil.  Adonis was revived by Dido, but Moloch sent false prophets to bring monotheism and predjudice to the world, styling himself as God.  Adonists believe they can create the perfected sixth aeon through worship of Adonis and Dido in sensual ritual.
§Y*§! Homosexual Adonist rulers are allowed to marry other homosexual characters.
§Y*§! Homosexual Reformed Adonist rulers are allowed to marry other homosexual characters.

The Shrauta are texual purists who reject the new forms of Hinduism, following exclusively the Vedas and strictly performing Vedic sacrifices and rituals.  Their cosmology, while borrowing some features from post-Vedic Indian religion, adheres closely to Vedic cosmology.  Ethically, they adhere strictly to the purity laws outlined within the Rig Veda.  Unlike other Hindus, where the goal of life is often Moksha, the Shrauta seek admittance to heaven to spend eternity with the Devas after strictly obeying the cosmic law of Rta and following their Dharma.

The Mantramarga is a strain of Shaiva thought that emphasizes liberation through the chanting of Mantras and devotional hymns as well some esoteric and ritual practices.  The event led to dominance of the Inchegeri Sampradaya who consolidated the sects of Shaivism and attempted to bridge the theological gaps between the sects. While only partially successful, nearly all recognize the differences as merely functional and that all paths lead to the same end, moksha and ultimately union with Shiva.

The worship of Vishnu dates back to long before the event and is based on the veneration of Vishnu as the supreme force of the universe.  This veneration is expressed through the devotion to one of his worldly forms, the Dashavatara.  Worship is done of a single form in order to perceive that aspect of the godhead and seek Union with him.  Previously, Buddha was seen as the ninth Avatar, but in the post-event world he has been replaced by Mahatma, the divine peacemaker.  Furthermore, while previously the most popular form was Krishna, in the post-event world people are more apt to worship Kaliki in order to bring him to restore Dharma to the world.

Shaktah is used for a wide variety of Goddess centric religions in India with a Hindu framework. The organized sect has its roots in the Tantric tradition of Bengal and the Himalayas absorbing Tantric Shaiva and Buddhist practice and deities while the lower form has its roots in the multitudes of local cults and goddesses all over India.  Theologically speaking, they see the supreme creative force as Shakti, also known as Prakriti, which is the origin of both the spiritual and the material world.  The supreme goddess is worshiped in a multitude of forms, both fierce and peaceful.

Combining the religious eclecticism of South India with modern ideas of Dravidian revivalism, the Thirumatami reject Brahaminical dominance of religion and instead favour local practices combined with Thirukkural inspired ethical systems.  Key to the faith are the wandering Samanars who practice extreme asceticism and are said to have achieved mystical powers called the siddhis and are in the lineage of the ancient Siddhars of Tamilakam.  The majority of adherents reject blood sacrifice, seeing it as against the ethics of Ahimsa described within the Thirukkural.  Like other religions within India, the adherents seek Moksha, the union with Brahman, the supreme soul, via the purification of all negative Karma.

Founded in the Pre-event days, Sikhism traces its lineage to 10 Gurus who face persecution from great empire of the time. Despite this persecution, they became a large and successful group, eventually carving out an empire.  The 10th Guru designated the collected revealed writings of the Sikh Sants, the Guru Granth Sahib, as the eternal Guru of Sikhism and implemented the 5 K's of Sikhism, giving it a martial spirit as well as the Four Prohibitions.  After the event, the Sikhs banded together around the ruins of the Armristar and eventually rebuilt their empire.  Over time, the Granthi's became the only ones able to read the Sri Guru and power became increasingly collected in their hands.  Additionally, the Sikhs began to accept the Nirmala's teachings as the esoteric alternative to orthodoxy.  This fusion created a system where the Nirmalas began to control the Gudwaras and acted as the major Granthis.

Ruism, also called Confucianism, is the guiding philosophy of China and one of the oldest religions in the world. While often considered simply a philosophy, it has acquired ritual elements over its long history and incorporates the worship of a diverse pantheon. The core of this religion is the relationship of the individual to his family and his nation, as well as the relationship of him to heaven.

Daoism is an ancient religion said to be based on the writings of Laozi, the wise master. Daoist practice involves the worship of deities and the practice of inner and outer alchemy as well as meditations to achieve a state called Wu Wei, effortless exertion to move with the monistic force of Dao.

Traditionally the most popular vehicle of Buddhism in East Asia, After the event new faiths and traditions have greatly diminished its prominence. Mahayana stresses the importance of the Bodhisattva, a multiplicity of enlightened beings who were inspired or were emulations of The Buddha's wisdom and compassion. The Buddha, Shakyamuni, cares deeply for all sentient beings so sent forth the Boddhisattvas to guide all sentient beings upon the Path of Enlightment so that all will find salvation and a life without suffering in the Heavenly Pure Realms.

The "Teachings of the Elders" school of Buddhism traces it's descent from the ancient Sthavira school patronized by Asoka.  They believe that their canon represents the authentic teachings of the Buddha while rejecting the Mahayana canons as additions.  In contrast to the Mahayanist", the Theravadins believe strongly in the idea of the arahant, a solitary monastic who achieves enlightenment through the Buddha's teachings and see the Bodhisatta path as a further ideal.  The Theravadins of Lanka see themselves as the oldest of the Buddhist communities, and afford a prominent place to monks as leaders of the community.  They notably accept 10-precept junior Bhikkhuni as legitimate, if junior, members of the Sangha.

Following the teachings of the Bodhisattva Ambedkar, these Buddhists, sometimes called Ambedkarites, reject outright many Buddhist doctrines including Annatta, Samsara, and the Aryasatyani," believing them to be Brahaminical interpolations.  They reject outright all "Hindu" deities and practices", instead seeing Buddhism as a vehicle for social change and things like Rebirth as merely a provisional truth, the release from suffering comes not from metaphysical enlightenment but personal social and intellectual liberation and all beings are liberated when society rejects notions of caste and class.

The Gelugpa are the "Yellow Hats" -- a school of Vajrayana Buddhism that has ruled Tibet for nearly a thousand years. Since the return to Lhasa under the Great 15th, there have been many changes as Gelugpa tulkus consolidated power under the Dalai Lama until he fully became the god-king of Tibet. In the recent schism over the Golden Urn and Hong control, the entrenched monastics followed the candidate recognized by the Panchen Lama. Staunch traditionalists, their adherence to the old ways and insistence on orthodoxy has turned away many potential followers and ultimately cost them their chance at taking the Lion Throne in the initial chaos of the Hong collapse.

Ngocholugspa, is a grand matriarchial order of lamas, who disputed the re-emergence of the 15th Dalai Lama as a fabrication set upon the Golden Urn by the machinations of Great Hong through their puppet who sits the Lion Throne. Fearing retribution they fled into the highlands holding to their belief that the true return of the "Great Dalai Lama" will usher a renewed age of prosperity fortold by the Buddha's great wisdom.

While Gelugpa has ruled for a thousand years, it is still the youngest of the major schools. Rime is a tradition that united the last of its competitors, the pre-Buddhist Bon faith and the ancient "Red Hat" schools -- Nyigma, Sakya, and Kagyu -- to protect and preserve the old ways. After the Dalai Lama usurped the title of Gaden Tripa and solidified his primacy over the Gelugpa, the masters of all four traditions denounced him and fled through the Himalayas with thousands of their followers to the secluded Kagyu kingdom of Bhutan, for which their descendants lay waiting for their time to exact their ancient rivalry with the Gelugpa.

Baha'i's descend from the Universalist movement of the prophet Bab and his successor Bahá'u'lláh. They believe that all religions are essentially one and that God had sent messengers to the world, known as "manifestations of god" to spread his teachings. These prophets were given the message of god to spread to each people according to their need, however over time a new prophet was needed to correct the mistakes of their followers, leading up to Bahá'u'lláh.

I am you, my children and children, you are me, all in the universe are one with the Cosmic principle.\nAn ancient organization of the Far East said to have existed before the Event itself. The first to witness the Divine Eye of The One True God was the great prophet Chieu Minh, his three disciples spread his message far and wide for it was a message of peace and redemption. Cast wide by the Event the believers of Cao Dai message roam Eurasia seeking audience with all peoples regardless of their lot in life to share the Cosmic Principle of the Heavenly Father.
Humans have imperfect perception, marred by subjectivity
column3: God has perfect perception, as he is perfect, we cannot directly percieve him.

column2: If possible, add in cultural conversion, reduced vassal opinion and increased demesne limit.

Just like the way Prince Csaba descended from the heavens riding on the Milky Way to defend his people when they needed it the most, we believe that the right person can defeat any foe and protect their nation at all cost.
A sufficiently powerful Anglican leader can vassalize the Archbishop of Canterbury.

column2: Kinh Thiên Ðao Và The Ðao
This character is a follower of the High Church, a believer in the Anglo-Catholic tradition.
This character is a follower of the Broad Church, believing in a middle ground on principles of church authority and rituals.
This character is a follower of the Low Church, believing in a decentralized church and less emphasis on rituals.

This character has chosen to focus on the virtue of Equality and take inspiration from Marianne, an antediluvian figure who was said to have lead the Jacobin faithful during the earliest days of the faith.

This character has chosen to focus on the virtue of Fraternity and take inspiration from the Emperor, a great conqueror who nearly united the world under the Jacobin faith, only falling against the combined forces of all the Perfidious.

This character has chosen to focus on the virtue of Liberty and take inspiration from the General, who, in the darkest hours of history, fought tirelessly for the freedom of the Jacobin faith and saved it from total destruction.
This character has chosen to focus on the legacy of La Sociale, fighting for pure equity and justice against the Chienlit.
This character is a follower of La Montagne, an ancient legendary society who bravely fought for the establishment of a great kingdom during the earliest days of the faith, long before the Event.
This character is known for their unrighteous behaviour and dishonoring Marianne by imposing their wicked fantasies of power over the realm.

Enlightenment is respected by the clergy and especially the head of your Religion. It can be spent to petition the head of your Religion. Like Prestige, it is added to your score on the death of a ruler.
